Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Chow \Chow\, n. [Chin. chou.] 1. A prefecture or district of the second rank in China, or the chief city of such a district; -- often part of the name of a city, as in Foochow. [Webster 1913 Suppl.]
2. a breed of thick-coated medium-sized dogs with fluffy curled tails and distinctive blue-black tongues; -- same as {chowchow[3]}, n.. [PJC]

Chow n 1: the imperial dynasty of China from 1122 to 221 BC; notable for the rise of Confucianism and Taoism [syn: {Zhou}, {Zhou dynasty}, {Chou}, {Chou dynasty}, {Chow dynasty}] 2: informal terms for a meal [syn: {chuck}, {eats}, {grub}] 3: breed of thick-coated medium-sized dogs with fluffy curled tails and distinctive blue-black tongues; believed to have originated in northern China [syn: {chow chow}]
